item.title: Way too many Lime Bikes, 8th November
item.description:
Too many Lime Bikes taking over on street parking bays. Parked illegally and on double yellow lines. And buses constantly knocking them over as they try to drive down the street. And dumped litter from baskets directly onto street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheep Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unswept leaves causing hazard in Hyde Vale, 8th November
item.description:
Every year in Autumn when the leaves fall from the many mature trees in front gardens at my side of the lower part of Hyde Vale between nos 2 - 30 there is the same problem. The road sweepers either ignore my side or do it so badly, especially on the corner of Hyde Vale and King George st, where they are left to rot. I have seen 2 or 3 sweepers on Monday mornings who do a very bad job or either don't come at all. They might sweep the road on the other side where there are hardly any trees but eitherignore or feebly sweep my side. PLEASE do something about this asap! I m elderly and walk with a stick so have to cross over from my house at no 20 to the other side, as I am frightened of falling

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Hyde Vale, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped again, 8th November
item.description:
This property is constantly dumping rubbish outside. Attracting rats and foxes again. Cannot walk on pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edwards Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless individual setting up tent in parking area, 8th November
item.description:
There is a homeless person who is setting up tent in one of the enclaves of the parking area. It started off as a fort made of card board boxes but seems to be expanding as time goes on, now including a tent. Its becoming a safety issue for residents as we dont know if the person is hostile or not. Most of us have to pass through there to get to the parking area, and it feels unsafe to do so when the person is there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wells Way, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves , debris and rubbish is piling up, 8th November
item.description:
It’s been here for Months and starts to collect a huge amount of rubbish and blocks the drain

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Cintra Park, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Broken glass on pavement / in road, 8th November
item.description:
It looks like somebody discarded a pint glass smashing it on the pavement – the mess left behind could be dangerous / damaging.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Dog Kennel Hill, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oil drums near lampost again, 8th November
item.description:
These oil drums keep getting dumped by the lamppost at the back of our property not only that but clothes and all sorts of there rubbish keep getting put here which is becoming a major problem if it was to catch fire the whole of our fence plus my shed with all my expensive tools would be distroyed to which id be looking to claim compensation for. I cant understand why as a council you still havent put up any signs about fly tipping or even a camera to catch the culprits out who keep persisting on doing this and making our lives a misery. The oil is a major hazard to drivers who come up this part as they will end up crashing this needs to be resolved ASAP before someone gets hurt and injured
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Lane, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped clothes and mattress, 8th November
item.description:
This tree is regularly used for abandoning all sorts of rubbish and the pile is growing every day. It has been a week now clothes, luggages and a mattress is here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amar Court, Plumstead, London

item.title: Sign is not in the correct position, 8th November
item.description:
Posting this again as my prior report has been ignored. We are now getting drivers getting out of their cabs and walking off. They also keep waving other vehicles around them so that vehicles are mounting the pavement to get round. This is now a danger to pedestrians. The sign that is there is too small, too low and in the wrong position. HGV’s are entering the road and reversing out 24/7. This is a continual danger and needs to be addressed asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pembroke Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
